Design the transaction tables for the Job Requisition system
Please use below mentioned details for redesign the JobRequisition table:
1. Core Identification & Status:
* id, jrId (auto-generated reference number)
* jrStatus (Draft, Pending DU Head Approval, Pending CDO Approval, etc.)
* submittedBy, createdAt,updatedAt
* isActive
2. Basic Details (Step 1):
* workArrangement, jobTypeId, coreSkillId, jobTitleId
* requestedDate, departmentId, requestedById, hiringManagerId
* numberOfPositions, expectedDateOfOnboardingStart/End, idealStartDateStart/End
* billable, clientBillingRate, totalBudgetMin/Max, expectedSalaryMin/Max
3. Skills & Qualifications (Step 2):
* Arrays: primarySkills, secondarySkills, niceToHaveSkills, qualifications, certifications
* specificQualification
* totalExperienceMin/Max, relevantExperienceMin/Max
4. Project & Client (Step 3):
* projectName, projectRole, clientName, clientCountryId, clientInterview
5. Location & Shift (Step 4):
* Arrays: workLocations
* workShifts, shiftTime, onsiteWorkMode, onsiteLocationId, onsiteDaysPerWeek, preferredTimeZoneId
6. Job Description (Step 5):
* jobPurpose, primaryDuties, goodToHaveDuties, jobSpecification
7. Onsite-Specific (Step 6):
* rate, rateUnit, rateCurrency, paymentCycle, visaStatuses
* contractDuration, durationUnit
* reportingManager, interviewProcess
* h1Transfer, travelRequired
8. Additional Required Fields:
* recruiterLeadId (FK to User) recruiterPocId (FK to User)   Foreign Key Relationships
* jobTypeId → JobType
* coreSkillId → Skill
* jobTitleId → JobTitle
* departmentId → Department
* requestedById → User
* hiringManagerId → User
* workShifts-> WorkShift
* clientCountryId → Country
* onsiteLocationId → OfficeLocation
* preferredTimeZoneId → WorkTimeZone
* recruiterLeadId → User
* recruiterPocId → User
*   Indexes for Performance
* jrStatus (frequently queried)
* departmentId (filtering by department)
* requestedById, hiringManagerId (user queries)
* workArrangement (Offshore/Onsite filtering)
* createdAt, updatedAt (date-based queries)
